content.question: Shown above is the graph of the differentiable function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, along with the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
